abstract.text: Provide users with current, actionable information connected to a reservation.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: Siri can expose reservation information from your app in context and at specific times so the user can take relevant actions based on the circumstances. Your app donates an

object that contains information about the reservation that can be sent to the user to allow them to confirm a hotel reservation, remind them to check in for a flight, help them return a rental car, and several other options.
If you send your users reservation information in email or web pages, use
to provide the information to Siri as well. Siri uses reservation IDs to prevent duplicate entries.

Apps offering reservations with check-in capabilities can integrate with Shortcuts Suggestions on the Lock Screen and allow users to launch your app to complete checking in for their reservation. Create a new reservation object with an array of

objects that contain a user activity and relevant time frame. Siri provides users with the ability to launch your app with the user activity and time frame information. For instance, a flight reservation app may provide users the ability to check-in for a flight starting 24 hours before the departure time.

abstract.text: Update users’ calendars and inform suggestions from Siri with reservation data embedded in email and webpages.
Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
The information that describes a boat reservation.
The information that describes a bus reservation.

A request for details about one or more reservations.
Your app’s response to a request for reservation details.
An interaction between the user and your app involving an intent object.
The information that describes a lodging reservation.
The information that describes a rental car reservation.
An object that describes a reservation.
An action a user can perform that’s relevant to a reservation.
Constants that describe the current status of the reservation.
The information that describes a restaurant reservation.
An object containing seat information associated with a reservation.
An action available in your app that the system may suggest to a user or a user may add to Siri.
Defined contexts in which an intent or activity might be relevant to a user.
An object representing an action available in your app that the system may suggest to a user or a user may add to Siri.
The information that describes a ticketed event reservation.
The information that describes a train reservation.
A shortcut the user added to Siri.
Retrieve the user’s shortcuts and make shortcut suggestions.
Empower users to interact with their devices through voice, intelligent suggestions, and personalized workflows.
Reveal your app’s shortcuts inside the Health app.
Add custom intents and parameters to help users interact more quickly and effectively with Siri and the Shortcuts app.
